author: Odeinoichus
title: Villainess Debut
review:
Set #41233 Lashina Tank: Look out Super Hero Girls, Lashina is about to unleash her mighty tank on the unsuspecting citizens, but Krypto the Super Dog is already aware of her imminent attack and will stop at nothing to defeat her. This makes another fun little set to pick up from the new DC Super Hero Girls Theme and this review will cover all of the reasons why.

Box/Instructions

Box: The box design is unique to the theme while still carrying over the elements one expects from these Mini-Doll themes. Images the showcase the set, fun looking artwork that features the characters in interesting looking ways and some interesting action poses. All around a great looking box design.

Instructions: Much like the box design the design for the manual is the same as past mini-doll themes. It follows along with the build quite easily with decent cross-promotional images for the entire range of sets available from LEGO for this Theme. Not much more to say than that.

Parts

The parts are all fairly standard for this range, meaning that you’ll find some nice unique colours that aren’t often seen in regular Minifigure based sets. The most noticeable are some more CHI crystals used for the Kryptomite build. Overall not a bad set for a parts pack.

Mini-Doll

Lashina: As a Mini-Doll Lashina is very impressive, her print is quite unique featuring some silver bands printed on her arms, across her face and over her torso, her legs feature some nice printing also for her socks and I believe she is one of a rare few who uses black for her costume. Her hair piece is also new with metal bands printed on her and her facial expression is very mean looking.

Lastly she is given the LEGO whip element in a nice grey colour. Overall a very impressive looking mini-doll.

Krypto: Krypto the Super Dog is the same newly sculpted animal piece from the Polybag, he’s a fun looking animal with a red cape and the S shield on his collar, you can also plug in an accessory on the top of his head, sunglasses, ribbons, whatever Friends accessories you have and want to use.

Kryptomite: This one is a nice looking light blue colour with a really sad facial expression. These buildable Kryptomite are great fun and a brilliant way to include enemies for the Super Hero Girls to fight when villains aren’t included.

The build

The two basic builds of this set are both fairly simple to follow along with. Krypto’s dog house looks great with some nice blue coloured bricks on top matching Superman’s costume colours. (Or Supergirl in some interpretations.)

Lashina’s Tank is also a fun little build that really looks menacing, the build really doesn’t strike me as difficult or frustrating and the model is a nice black in colour which is a huge change from most other Mini-Doll set vehicles. Considering this is a villain vehicle that makes a lot of sense. Really fun builds all around.

The completed model

Lashina Tank: This four-wheeled menace has a cow-catcher style drill or cutting tool on the front and a cage in back to capture Krypto with, it also features a stud-shooter and is an all-around impressive looking model with a great combination of black and dark rose coloured pieces. It’s fun to roll around and launch against the heroes, or perhaps lead an attack on Heartlake City with this menacing looking monstrosity.

Krypto’s Dog House: This is just a fun looking model, I don’t know why, but I get shades of Snoopy’s dog house from this build. It’s got a similar old-school style look and features some nice play features. The front door can rotate open, a catapult to defend against Lashina is on top and a little fire hydrant is included for when Krypto needs to take care of business.

Stickers are used primarily for details, the only exceptions are the printed stud with an exclamation point and the tile piece which looks like a cell phone… So Krypto the Super Dog needs a cell phone? Odd choice, but pretty great print, since it includes the S shield for the home button.

Overall opinion

Overall this is a really great set, and it’s one of the first wave that will be retiring soon. If you haven’t already picked it up I’d definitely recommend tracking it down, on LEGO S&H in Canada it’s still on discount as well as retiring soon.
